name: Kfar Maccabiah Hotel & Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't get me wrong. It is a nice hotel with price to match. The room was comfortable and for being in the city, quiet. Parking was available close to the hotel. Breakfast was fantastic!!!
reviews.title: Centrally located for Israel Visit

reviews.text: But, the reason I chose this location is because I was renting a car and was planning to drive to and visit various cities and sights. This place is about 5 minutes from the main north/south highway and only a few minutes more from the main Jerusalem/Tel Aviv road. So I was willing to pay a little bit more to not get stuck in Tel Aviv or Jerusalem traffic.
reviews.title: Second time and it's got great facilities

reviews.text: I stayed here 4 years ago, so decided again this time whilst visiting family nearby. The hotel is on a big sport complex and business center, so the surroundings are pretty busy. The hotel itself is pretty good and has everything you need. The rooms I have had are pretty average rooms, nothing major to write home about, but the facilities are excellent. WIFI is free in the rooms, buffet breakfast is included in the price and has a large choice, and the country club was nice, it's good with warm weather as there is a large outdoor swimming pool which my child loved. There are large grounds and other swimming pools, slides and a playground. So, I think this is a pretty good all round hotel. I would stay again.
reviews.title: One Year Later and Still No Better.... Time to Move On...

reviews.text: I first stayed in this hotel in April 2012, and after that trip I gave the hotel a dissappointing review. Now, one year later, I can report than nothing has changed. I'm not staying here again.
reviews.title: Great complex

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet is huge, but it never changes, and the cooked portions of the buffet are dismal. I had the fellow make me an omlet one morning and he made me feel like I really had intruded on his time. The coffee, by the way, is undrinkable. The same large room is used for the dinner buffet and it is equally inedible. Plus, I asked for a glass of white wine and it took three waiters to figure out what I wanted. No charm, no sophistication, no gentleness.
reviews.title: Nice for an Overnight or for Sports fanatics

reviews.text: The place is especially known for the swimming pool. The hotel itself is nice compared to other hotels in Israel. There are a couple of things to take into account. No check in on Shabbat. The parking lot is a bit far, and it is just an empty space.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location

reviews.text: Breakfast is much better than average. Overall the experience is great.
reviews.title: Great rooms; great food

reviews.text: I've now stayed twice in Kfar Maccabiah and have really enjoyed it. The rooms I have stayed in have been a small suite, with a bedroom, sitting room, a full bath (tub and shower) and a half bath. There is a kettle for coffee or tea in the room. The sofa in the sitting room can double as a bed. The breakfast is fantastic with more variety than one can imagine. The dinners are also good. My stays have been either arriving in Tel Aviv or departing from the airport, and both times I've wished I could stay longer just to enjoy the hotel.
reviews.title: good value for money

reviews.text: Kfar Maccabiah is a large renovated and comfortable hotel in Ramat Gan, next to the national park and the zoo ("Safari").
reviews.title: It's okay but lacking care.

reviews.text: The room is big, comfy and very clean. There's not much view but very quiet outside (which I cannot say on the inside, the walls are thin). The only problem with the room is the water facilities in the bathroom, which were quite shaky and not completely attached to there place.
reviews.title: An OK Hotel with Delusions of Adequacy

reviews.text: This is the second time that I stay in this hotel for business (in the hotel wing). The rooms are clean and have free wifi. The business center (in the suites wing) is excellent for working and business meetings. There is a big sports club attached to the hotel with several outdoor swimming pools and an indoor gym. The hotel itself has got a small but expensive spa, too.
reviews.title: Very good hotel for business and sports

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel one night during a conference. The accommodation included two beds room and meals: lunch, dinner, breakfast and lunch.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: The room was nice and spacious, furnished with two beds, a sofa, a table and a desk.
reviews.title: An experience we would love to repeat!

reviews.text: It included LCD TV and a kettle.
reviews.title: Just for one night... if you're not waiting too much

reviews.text: The bathroom was clean and spacious as well.
reviews.title: Great location, Great vacation

reviews.text: Stayed for one night at the hotel wing (there's also the suites wing). Room was small, old-looking and not very clean. Beds (two single-bed attached) were not comfortable.
reviews.title: An over-rated hotel

reviews.text: The buffet breakfast was good.
reviews.title: Nice but far away

reviews.text: Its located far from pretty much everything- the business district, the sea front and busy city. but the rooms are comfortable and spacious, the lounge is warm and the breakfast is done very nicely. the dinner though is heavy meats.
reviews.title: excellent for business trip

reviews.text: spent 3 nights in suit-room 1503. very comfortable. breakfast excellent. the location is far from city center and you need a taxi if you want to go there. i was hosted by company who took me out. if it is not the case - consider the tranportation needed.The resturant and bar very nice.
reviews.title: Convenient !

reviews.text: Spent 4 nights at this hotel during a business trip. Had the suites which were very spacious and comfortable. Good internet connection (free). Bathroom was ok even thoough found a little rust during a bath ! The breakfast was excellent with a wide variety to eat. Located in a sports centre so great also if you want to work out. Would reccomend even for visiting Tel Aviv centre as only 10/15 mins by taxi.
reviews.title: Great place!

description: Every guest is treated to five star hospitality in the hotel's 260 deluxe room and exclusive suites: complimentary use of advanced sports facilities, a luxurious lobby, sports restaurants, bar, cafeteria, business lounge, mini market, synagogue pampering spa and many engaging activities for children, teenagers and adults.
